docblock.description: A class that represents a request to the engine, mainly used via an Action mapped into Actions module.

var.description: $pathComponents An Array of RequestPathComponent objects defining the components of this request, in the same order on which they're expected
$parameters An Array of RequestParameter objects of parameters that might be received by this request
$parameterValues A two-dimensional array of retrieved parameters for this request, filled by retrieveParameterValues()

Whether this Request should perform checks aimed to mitigate CSRF attacks, like adding a per-user unique token to requests and checking it agains the token stored on the user's session, or checking for a matching domain on the request coming from the user's browser against the current domain.
$additionalCacheKeys A two-dimensional array containing additional cache keys to make this request's cached contents different depending on the values of those keys

param.description: How to populate the created Request object. Leave to false for unpopulated request.

docblock.description: Retrieves all the parameters bonded to this Request, coming either from path component strings, get or post. It also performs security checks on them when needed

return.description: True if all the parameters have been retrieved correctly and no security issues found, false otherwise

comment.value: Retrieve parameters coming from path components
Retrieve parameters coming from get or post

return.description: Whether the specified parameter $name has been passed or not

description.compact: Gets the value retrieved for a specific parameter for this request. retrieveParameterValues() must be called before.

param.description: The name of the parameter to get

description.compact: Magic get method to return the retrieved value for a specific parameter for this request. retrieveParameterValues() must be called before.

return.description: The data. Null if data with the given key is not set.

description.compact: Magic method to check if the specified parameter has been passed or not

param.description: True if the data parameter has been passed, false otherwise

return.description: Whether this request must implement security against Csrf attacks

description.compact: Returns a URL that represents a call to this request, including the given path components and parameter values

param.description: An option setup two-dimensional array containing:

docblock.param: * parameterValues: An optional two-dimensional array containing values for the parameters related to this request, including url path parameters and get/post parameters (not additionalCacheKeys, since they're not represented on the Url itself). * isIncludeUrlParameters: Set to true to also include the URL parameters (doesn't refers to pathComponents, which are always included when needed). The passed parameterValues will be used, or the current request's parameters if no parameterValues are specified. Defaults to true. * isAbsolute: Whether to generate an absolute url containing additionally http(s):// and the domain of the App. Defaults to false * isHttps: Whether to generate an https url or not, with the following possible values: - true: Use https:// - false: Use http:// - "auto": Use https:// if the current request has been made over https, http:// otherwise

description.compact: Returns an HTML form that will call this request when submitted

param.description: The prefix to use for the cache key

An optional two-dimensional array containing values for all the parameters related to this request, including url path parameters, get/post parameters and additionalCacheKeys. If not specified, the current retrieved values will be used

return.description: A string that represents uniquely this request, to be used as a cache key

description.compact: Checks this request for security problems

return.description: True if no issues found during checking, false otherwise.
